author: Oz
title: CashFlow NFT fraud continues with BG Lifestyle Club
text:
CashFlow NFT fraud continues with BG Lifestyle Club
[companies](https://behindmlm.com/companies/)
CashFlow NFT’s latest grift is BG Lifestyle Club, a “CPU ownership” fraudulent investment scheme.
The launch follows an [email from owner Micah Theard](https://behindmlm.com/companies/cashflow-nft-fraud-continues-with-boogie-gopher-nfts/#comment-487166) making excuses for CashFlow NFT investor losses.
“I’m so frustrated with Miracle Cash & More! I invested two years ago, and I still haven’t seen a return!”
We understand that sentiment, and we’ve heard it from others as well. It’s natural to feel this way, so we wanted to take the time to address it directly.
In attempting to explain away investor losses, Theard trots out nonsense about “regulatory challenges”.
This ruse is centered around new MiCA laws in Europe.
Things fall apart upon consideration MiCA has nothing to do with securities law and securities regulation. Notwithstanding it was [the same ruse used to collapse the Mavie Global Ponzi scheme](https://behindmlm.com/companies/mavie-globals-ultron-ponzi-scheme-collapses/#comment-482642).
Of additional note in Theard’s email is the claim;
Collectively, our community owns over 30% of Miracle Technologies/Metaterra, and as we push in the next 3 years toward a $100 billion valuation, the community’s stake could grow to over $30 billion, solidifying our place in history.
And that CashFlow NFT is
days away from delivering our capitalization contract to the SEC to capitalize the company to 500 million.
Miracle Technologies, aka Miracle Cash & More, is associated with [CashFlow NFT](https://behindmlm.com/mlm-reviews/cashflow-nft-review-nft-real-estate-themed-securities-fraud/), they are effectively one and the same.
[MetaTerra](https://behindmlm.com/companies/cashflow-nft-fraud-continues-with-metaterra-the-sec/), a shell company CashFlow NFT acquired as part of efforts to create legitimacy around its unregistered investment scheme, is currently delinquent in its SEC filings.
MetaTerra’s Annual 10-K report for the financial year ending December 2023 was due on April 1st, 2024. It is now seven and a half months overdue.
There is also no mention of any of CashFlow NFT’s investment schemes in any of MetaTerra’s filings. Officially, MetaTerra’s filed business description with the SEC is “selling auto parts”.
Moving on to BG Lifestyle Club, Theard and business partner Hakan Törehan are soliciting investment on claims of purported
agreements with two of the world’s largest merchant processing companies, with access to 100 million active terminals in 120+ countries.
The ruse is that these companies aren’t accepting crypto payments, which is where CashFlow NFT and begging more for more investment comes in.
To earn from these terminals, merchants must be notified about their option to accept crypto. This expansion requires funding, and that’s where you come in.
The business model sees already rinsed CashFlow NFT investors deposit $900 on the promise of $30 or more “per asset per month and growing with network success”.
I.e. the more people invest, the higher the returns.
BG Lifestyle Club has its own referral commissions, paid out down three levels of recruitment:
- level 1 (personally recruited affiliates) – 8%
- levels 2 and 3 – 3%
Note that Theard doesn’t specify the investment amount but does provide referral commission rate examples:
Tier 1 (10 referrals at 8%): $720.00
Reverse math’ing the above we get $900 per investment.
Finally there’s also a shit token ROI component to BG Lifestyle Club;
Every member starts with daily earnings of at least $1 in Phoenic tokens. Over time, this income can grow as the network expands and the token value increases.
CashFlow NFT[ launched Phoenic token last year](https://behindmlm.com/companies/batched-investors-being-funneled-into-cashflow-nft-ponzi/) and, not surprisingly, so far it’s gone nowhere. Watch for trouble when BG Lifestyle Club starts only paying out in Phoenic tokens.
Pending any further updates, in particular the SEC taking action on MetaTerra’s delinquent filings, we’ll keep you posted.

author: Mary Walrath-Holdridge
title: Kathleen Wilson's Minnesota dentist did 30 procedures at once: lawsuit
text: A Minnesota dentist has become the subject of a malpractice lawsuit after his patient accused him of "disfiguring" her. The civil lawsuit was filed in Hennepin County, Minnesota last week by Kathleen Wilson, who alleged Dr. Kevin Molldrem and Molldrem Family Dentistry caused her significant injury that is still being corrected. According to the suit, Molldrem performed more than 30 producers on Wilson in a single July 2020 visit, doing eight crowns, four root canals and 20 fillings in one go. The lawsuit alleges that the dentist "perform[ed] this work improperly," resulting in pain and suffering, embarrassment, emotional distress, and disfigurement. Molldrem was likewise accused of using improper levels of anesthesia during the procedures and falsifying medical records to cover it up. “It is inconceivable that Dr. Molldrem could have prepared and placed 8 crowns under these circumstances in the time allotted, not to mention the additional 20 restorations,” wrote Dr. Avrum Goldstein, a dentist and expert witness brought on by Wilson's attorney, in an affidavit. Goldstein, who is a faculty member at NOVA Southeastern University , also wrote that Wilson had been correctly diagnosed as having a "rare condition" causing decay in almost all of her teeth, but Mollderm's course of action was not a proper form of treatment. "[Wilson’s] required a slow, thoughtful, careful and measured response to her disease,” he said in his report. “Trying to fill every hole in every tooth in her mouth in one visit is not only the antithesis of what was indicated, it is not humanly possible to achieve in an effective or constructive manner.” Doctors remove wrong organ from man: They opened him up to remove his appendix. They mistakenly took out much more, lawsuit says. The lawsuit also accused Mollderm of tampering with medical records to falsify the amount of anesthesia that was reportedly used, which in reality was nearly double the standard number of units, according to court paperwork. According to Goldstein, the maximum dose of anesthesia given in three hours should not exceed 490 mg, but Molldrem's records show he gave Wilson 960 mg. “Any negative cardiovascular or central nervous system outcomes could be tied to the local anesthetic overdose," he wrote. Wilson said in the suit that she has since had to have the dental work completely redone by other dentists to repair Molldrem’s “negligent work," an ongoing process that has caused her to lose income and rack up medical bills on top of enduring pain, suffering and embarrassment. She is seeking more than $50,000 in damages. Wilson's attorney and Molldrem did not immediately respond to request for comment.

author: Dr. Christopher Kunz
title: Ex-Admin des Darknet-Marktplatzes warnt: BreachForums ist eine Polizei-Falle | heise online
text:
close notice
This article is also available in English . It was translated with technical assistance and editorially reviewed before publication.
Don’t show this again .
Ende April 2025 verschafften sich Strafverfolger Zugriff auf den Darknet-Marktplatz "BreachForums", die Administratoren schlossen die Sicherheitslücke und stellen das Forum unter anderer Adresse erneut ins Netz. Nun scheint gewiss: In Wirklichkeit hatten Kriminalisten, nicht Kriminelle die Kontrolle über den Tummelplatz für Datenhehler. Das bestätigte ein Mitglied der Gruppe, die das Forum administrierte.
Anzeige Das Forum "BreachForums" diente zu seinen Hochzeiten Datendieben und -Hehlern als Anlaufstelle für ihre Geschäfte. Hier verkaufte "IntelBroker", ein mittlerweile inhaftierter Brite, Daten aus Angriffen auf HPE und Cisco, auch Gratistickets für Konzerte der Sängerin Taylor Swift waren im Angebot. Das Forum stand ständig im Fadenkreuz internationaler Ermittler. Als es von eben jenen Ende April übernommen und vom Netz gefegt wurde – angeblich mittels eines Exploits für eine Sicherheitslücke der Forumssoftware –, sorgte das für Misstrauen. Nicht unbegründet: Darknet-Foren werden immer wieder von Strafverfolgern als "Honigtopf" weiterbetrieben, um Beweise gegen Cyberkriminelle zu sammeln.
Videos by heise
mehr Videos
Fünf der Administratoren, darunter Mitglieder der Gruppe "ShinyHunters", sitzen seit Juni in Haft , doch das Forum tauchte bald unter neuer Adresse wieder auf. Nun wird scheinbar zur Gewissheit, was viele Forumsmitglieder vermuteten: BreachForums ist selber "breached", Behörden betrieben das Forum weiter und sammelten so wichtige Informationen im Kampf gegen Cyberkriminalität.
Lebenszeichen mit PGP-Signatur Das behauptet einer, der es wissen muss: Eines der Mitglieder der Gruppe ShinyHunters. In mehreren Nachrichten – eine davon veröffentlicht auf dem bei Kriminellen beliebten Messenger Telegram – warnt er seine Mitnutzer: Jedwede Nutzeraktivität auf BreachForums werde von Behörden zur Beweissicherung mitgeschnitten und der Code des Forums sei manipuliert. Man solle das Forum nicht mehr nutzen.
Ungewöhnliches Darknet-Angebot: In den BreachForums gab es auch mal gefälschte Digitaltickets für Konzerte der Sängerin Taylor Swift. Diese Zeiten sind womöglich vorbei. Für seine persönliche Sicherheit gibt der Unbekannte Entwarnung: Weder er, noch die kriminelle Infrastruktur der Gruppierung "ShinyHunters" sei kompromittiert. Frühere Medienberichte sprachen von der Inhaftierung mindestens eines Mitglieds der Gruppierung. An der Authentizität der Nachrichten besteht zunächst wenig Zweifel: Sie sind beide mit dem PGP-Schlüssel signiert, den "ShinyHunters" seit Jahren nutzt. Zudem scheint es wenig wahrscheinlich, dass dieser Schlüssel unter der Kontrolle der Behörden steht: Diese werden Gauner wohl kaum vor ihren eigenen Ermittlungen warnen wollen.
Anzeige Forum offline – für immer? Unmittelbar nach ShinyHunters' zweiter Nachricht ging BreachForums erneut offline und ist es noch. Ob neben dem zeitlichen auch ein ursächlicher Zusammenhang besteht, kann nur gemutmaßt werden. Sicher ist jedoch: Viele Nutzer haben das Vertrauen in ihre einstige Darknet-Heimat wohl endgültig verloren und sind in andere Untergrundforen abgewandert. Denen droht jedoch ein ähnliches Schicksal: Auch das eher auf Malware-Entwicklung spezialisierte Forum XSS steht im Verdacht , durch Strafverfolger infiltriert zu sein.
( cku )
Dieser Link ist leider nicht mehr gültig. Links zu verschenkten Artikeln werden ungültig, wenn diese älter als 7 Tage sind oder zu oft aufgerufen wurden.

author: Mariano R.
title: DALL-E est de plus en plus nul ! Microsoft annule une mise à jour ratée de son IA d'images
text:
Microsoft s’est pris une belle claque avec la dernière mise à jour de son système de génération d’images Bing. Ce dernier qui utilise le modèle DALL-E d’OpenAI. Les utilisateurs s’attendaient à une amélioration, mais franchement, PR16, la nouvelle version, a été un véritable désastre. Microsoft a dû annuler la mise à jour et revenir à une version précédente.
Microsoft a donc dû se résoudre à annuler sa dernière mise à jour pour Bing Images. Celle-ci qui est propulsée par le modèle DALL-E d’OpenAI. La version PR16, censée offrir des images de meilleure qualité et un traitement plus rapide, a été un échec cuisant. Ainsi, face aux critiques virulentes des utilisateurs, la firme de Redmond a décidé de faire marche arrière. Une décision qui montre à quel point même les géants de la tech peuvent trébucher dans la course à l’innovation. Que s’est-il passé pour que tout parte en vrille ?
Microsoft revient en arrière sur sa mise à jour ratée
Microsoft avait promis que cette mise à jour serait « deux fois plus rapide et de meilleure qualité ». Jordi Ribas, un des responsables de la boîte, jurait même que leurs tests internes montraient une « légère amélioration ».
Toutefois, sur le terrain, c’était une autre histoire. Les utilisateurs, notamment sur des forums comme Reddit, ont rapidement remarqué que les images générées par PR16 étaient loin d’être à la hauteur. Le commentaire qui résume tout ? « Le DALL-E qu’on aimait est mort. »
Since the launch of Bing Image Creator last spring, users have generated billions of images with text prompts. I'm pleased to share our latest updates to enhance your creative experience. Starting today, we’re rolling out the latest DALL-E 3 model PR16, which will create images…
[pic.twitter.com/3p9HsYMlr6]— Jordi Ribas (@JordiRib1)[December 18, 2024]
J’ai vu passer des exemples, et c’est clair que la qualité a pris une claque. Les détails sont flous, les couleurs mal gérées… tout ce qui rendait DALL-E cool a disparu. Par conséquent, la frustration des utilisateurs a forcé Microsoft à réagir.
Face à la grogne, Microsoft n’a pas eu le choix que de retourner à PR13, une version plus ancienne, mais bien plus fiable. Jordi Ribas a annoncé sur X le 8 janvier que le rollback était en cours. Mais attention, ça ne se fait pas d’un claquement de doigts.
Selon lui, il faudra encore « 2 à 3 semaines » pour que tout le monde profite de cette version corrigée. En attendant, ceux qui utilisent Bing Images risquent de devoir composer avec des bugs.
Ce n’est pas la première fois qu’un générateur d’images basé sur l’IA déçoit. Souvenez-vous, en février dernier, Google avait aussi désactivé temporairement le modèle d’image de Gemini. Pourquoi ? Parce qu’il avait généré des images racistes et carrément offensantes.
Je trouve cette situation frustrante, mais au moins, Microsoft semble écouter sa communauté. Espérons qu’ils tireront les leçons de cette expérience et éviteront de balancer des mises à jour non prêtes à l’avenir.
Et vous, avez-vous testé la version PR16 de DALL-E sur Bing Images ? Quelles ont été vos impressions ? Partagez vos expériences en commentaire !
- Partager l'article :

author: Colleen Dilthey Thomas
title: Hugely Popular Restaurant Chain Closes 600 Locations In 1 Year - NewsBreak
text: This might come as a surprise, but Subway is the largest restaurant chain in the world. Many people assume that places that sling burgers and fries are on top, but Subway occupies the most restaurant real estate globally. While the sandwich shop seems to dominate the market, it may be losing star power. According to Restaurant Busines s, Subway closed 600 locations in 2024. This is the first time in two decades that the chain has dipped under 20,000 locations in the United States. Per the FDD via Restaurant Business, Subway peaked in 2015 with 27,100 restaurants in the /us alone. Since 2015, Subway has closed 7,600 restaurants. From 2015 to 2023, Subway closed about 950 locations a year. So, the news from 2024 isn’t all bad for the sandwich shop. Even with thousands of locations across the U.S., Starbucks is set to eclipse Subway as the most prolific chain in the country. As food prices rise and people continue to be more selective about how they spend their money, every business has to do its best to attract new customers. Subway is no different. They frequently introduce new menu items to attract business. The newest addition is the Doritos Footlong Nachos. “we had to go with @Doritos Footlong Nachos cause triangle subs wouldn’t fit in the sandwich sleeve. limited time at participating restaurants,” Subway shared on Instagram . This person loved them, “I could eat the Doritos footlong nachos for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.” “You understood the assignment, and now we get to eat it,” this fan agreed. After hearing that many Subway locations are closed, this person thinks they know why. “I hear you guys are closing a bunch of stores, ngl, I stopped going when you guys made your new menu and got rid of the sourdough bread here in the Bay Area. Get it together.” This story’s featured image is by Olga Nayashkova via Shutterstock. The post Hugely Popular Restaurant Chain Closes 600 Locations In 1 Year appeared first on InspireMore .

title: Пушистый герой: в Швейцарии нашли провалившегося в трещину ледника мужчину благодаря его собаке - что произошло
text:

Пушистый герой: в Швейцарии нашли провалившегося в трещину ледника мужчину благодаря его собаке — что произошло
Сегодня, 10 июля в 16:58, Россия/мир
Собака спасла своего хозяина на леднике
Фото: cbsnews.com
Крошечная чихуахуа спасла своего хозяина, провалившегося в горную расщелину. Маленький герой своим лаем указал спасателям, где искать пострадавшего.
Мужчина, пожелавший остаться неизвестным, совершал пеший поход по леднику Фе на юге Швейцарии. Его сопровождала бело-коричневая длинношёрстная чихуахуа.
Турист ступил на сугроб и свалился в скрытую под снегом расщелину. Путешественник напрасно пытался выбраться и застрял на глубине восьми метров. Он подал сигнал бедствия через любительскую рацию.
Его услышал другой турист, который сразу вызвал спасателей. Команда прибыла к леднику на вертолёте, но найти мужчину оказалось непросто.
Инцидент мог закончиться трагедией, ведь на леднике самая малая ошибка может стоить жизни. Но в самый трудный момент четвероногий друг пришёл на помощь хозяину, пишет
CBS News
.
Маленькая собака неподвижно стояла на одном месте и лаяла изо всех сил. Спасатели подошли к ней поближе и увидели расщелину. Они спустились к пострадавшему на верёвке и вытащили его.
Ранее «Хибины» сообщили, что произошло
с героической Лайкой
в космосе на самом деле.
До этого мы рассказали, что в России снимут фильм о трогательной истории
бездомного кота,
пришедшего на могилу бойца СВО.

author: Ethan White
title: World No.2, Alexander Zverev, Determined to Bounce Back in Miami Following Australian Open Disappointment
text:
Following a lacklustre performance at the Indian Wells Masters, world number two, Alexander Zverev, is setting his sights on Miami with aspirations of reviving his form. His recent tennis showing, particularly since the Australian Open, has left much to be desired.
Zverev’s arrival in Miami comes on the heels of an unexpected early departure from the Indian Wells Masters. The German tennis star has had a challenging time maintaining his top-tier performance since his commendable run at the Australian Open. This dip in form has left fans and critics alike questioning if he can regain his momentum.
Known for his exceptional talent and indomitable spirit, Zverev has a reputation for bouncing back from low points in his career. Miami now serves as the perfect platform for him to demonstrate his resilience and ability to turn the tide in his favour.
Zverev’s journey in Miami could serve as a pivotal point in his season, allowing him to regain his footing and restore his confidence. His ambition to “turn things around” signifies his determination to rectify his recent performance dip and reclaim his place among the top players in the world.
This refreshing outlook from Zverev is a testament to his character and dedication to his sport. Despite facing a challenging phase, his resolve remains unbroken, and his focus on the task at hand is commendable. His journey in Miami will undoubtedly be a spectacle to watch, as tennis enthusiasts worldwide anticipate the revival of his top form.
In conclusion, Zverev’s impending performance in Miami is a crucial checkpoint in his career. As he seeks to bounce back from his recent slump, the world eagerly awaits to see if the German prodigy can successfully navigate these choppy waters and showcase his true mettle on the tennis court. His determination to turn things around in Miami might just be the spark needed to reignite his season.

author: Devdiscourse News Desk
title: Delhi Metro Launches E-Waste Recycling Initiative with Japanese Collaboration | Business
text: Delhi Metro Launches E-Waste Recycling Initiative with Japanese Collaboration The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation, in collaboration with a Japanese firm, will inaugurate e-waste recycling boxes at 15 metro stations for the disposal of printer ink bottles and cartridges. The launch event, featuring the Japanese ambassador and DMRC's MD Vikas Kumar, is scheduled for Friday evening. [Devdiscourse News Desk](/devdiscourse-stories)| New Delhi | Updated: 19-07-2024 15:10 IST | Created: 19-07-2024 15:10 IST - Country: - India The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC), in a joint effort with a Japanese company, is set to unveil electronic-waste recycling boxes on Friday evening, officials have confirmed. The recycling boxes will be available for the disposal of printer ink bottles and cartridges at 15 metro stations across the city. The initiative aims to promote responsible e-waste management, ensuring that these commonly used items are recycled properly. The event is scheduled to start at 4:30 pm and will be attended by the Japanese ambassador and DMRC Managing Director Vikas Kumar. This move is part of a broader effort by DMRC to incorporate sustainable practices in its operations, reflecting growing global concerns about electronic waste and its environmental impact. (With inputs from agencies.) ALSO READ [China Seizes Taiwanese Trawler: Psychological Warfare or Environmental Protection?](/article/law-order/3005626-china-seizes-taiwanese-trawler-psychological-warfare-or-environmental-protection) [Unchecked Air Pollution: Congress Accuses Modi Government of Weakening Environmental Norms](/article/science-environment/3006074-unchecked-air-pollution-congress-accuses-modi-government-of-weakening-environmental-norms) [Global Blueprint for Health: WHO and UN Unveil Comprehensive Environmental Guide](/article/science-environment/3006374-global-blueprint-for-health-who-and-un-unveil-comprehensive-environmental-guide) [Cambodia Faces International Backlash Over Sentencing of Environmental Activists](/article/law-order/3006381-cambodia-faces-international-backlash-over-sentencing-of-environmental-activists) [BSF and SBI Bank Unite for Green Environment Initiative in Srinagar](/article/headlines/3007782-bsf-and-sbi-bank-unite-for-green-environment-initiative-in-srinagar)
